main event: A ground-radar observation in Yakima, Washington on 9-27-57 reported approximately 6-10 objects exhibiting erratic maneuvers, with one object emitting a bright red glow before turning white and wiping out the radar scope.
interesting points: Approximately 6-10 objects were observed during the ground-radar observation.
One object exhibited erratic maneuvers and emitted a bright red glow before turning white.
The erratic maneuvers of the objects caused the entire radar scope to be wiped out.
The observation was reported by a pilot of Northwest Airlines flight 535 and a tower operator at Yakima Airport.
Another observation from 12-24-54 reported 10 objects at different altitudes and speeds, and a meteorite-like appearance was reported by an airline pilot.
witnesses: pilot of Northwest Airlines flight 535, tower operator at Yakima Airport
